reviewText: WILL & GRACE didn't leave much to the imagination, during the course of their fourth season.  In fact, there is something juicy, here, for just about every character.  As an example, Jack McFarland (Sean Hayes), who we know best as the opportunistic and childlike best friend of Will (Eric McCormack) has a son, Elliott (Michael Angarano), from his stint as a sperm donor.  In an effort to bond with Elliott, Jack spends time with him and introduces the boy to his world, as well as trying to relate to the pre-teen in his own world.  Grace (Debra Messing) is still involved with her upstairs neighbor (Woody Harrelson), if but for a brief time.  Karen (Megan Mullally), Grace's perpetually pill popping/drunk "assistant," runs into some legal trouble with her often spoke of, but never seen, husband, Stan.  Will (Eric McCormack)'s father is Sidney Pollack, in a hilarious, recurring role.  Need I say more?  There are many other celebrity guest stars, as well, like Lesley Ann Warren and Parker Posey, in a hilarious turn as Jack's bitchy manager at his sweater folding job at the mall.  This is a great season, folks.  Give it a spin!
summary: a season filled with guest stars and quirky twists......
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: It has been a while since SEASON 3 came out, we were waiting for the fourth one in april ! So let's hope that it is released 4 months  later to let enough time to the "dvd makers" to make a great set, with ENGLISH and FRENCH(PLEASE !!!) subtitles and a lot of behind-the-scenes, bloopers, interviews ... !!!!I can't wait to have it, to watch it and to complete my collection with this fourth season that I have never seen because in france they stop broadcasting the show at the end of the third season !!I, in any case, love the artwork :)

reviewText: Will & Grace is one of my favorite shows and it will continue to be even when it ends next year. I bought the 1st season when it came out but after that I decided I would wait till the series ends so that way I could buy the box set whenever it comes out. It will have 8 seasons in it probably costing about $100 and something.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: If you didn't feel the magic disappear at the start of season 4 you'll really FEEL IT NOW by the time you finish this season! Will & Grace was always a great show from the beginning and pure magic from seasons 1 - 3. But when season 4 started with Woody Harrelson as Grace's love interest the chemistry and magic between all the lead characters seem to disappear over night. Will & Grace never really had the FUNNY CRAZY lines but they worked well with what they were given. Instead all the good lines were given to Jack & Karen. Pretty much in my opinion for the shows 8 year run it's always secretly been called the Jack & Karen show. Anyways at this point since Will & Grace weren't even given any decent lines, the below average lines that were given they had to turn humorous which just came off really desperate and made the 2 characters even more annoying then they originally were. The show from this point just doesn't have any element to keep you tuning in each week and starts to decline quite gradually. Every episode of this season is almost a pain to watch. You try and look forward to the next laugh and all you get are bad jokes with bad a delivery from the actors and a lot of empty spaces in-between when waiting for the next joke. Every episode you could already tell this show was on its last legs. It wasn't about making people laugh anymore. It was more about learning a life lesson at the end of each episode. When a show starts to become learning about Life Lessons that's when it becomes like the Family Matters sitcom and SLOW torture. I was in shock that this show went on for 8 years. When the show 1st started and after an amazing season 3 I always thought this show would last longer then the over rated Friends sitcom. I also asked myself how are they gonna top the AMAZING 3rd season. But after season 4 it was time to hang up the hat and call it a day. As i mentioned it was always about Jack & Karen and the writers or producers really OVER USED the 2 characters to do crazy things and in all honesty i think the actors PASSION for doing the show started to dwindle. There comes a point in everyone's job if you're in the same position for years where you feel like you know what you're doing and that you've MASTERED the art of IT and nothing is a challenge anymore. That situation applies here and you can really feel that with the cast of Will & Grace. Despite that my review maybe coming off negative i do like all of the 4 main actors and this is Will & Grace so i rated it with a 4 star even though i wanted it to be 3 1/2. But because its Will & Grace i still give it a chance. Bare this in mind, the CAST became so GREAT at their CRAFT that they became INVALUABLE.
summary: WOW!!! ....and that's NOT a GOOD THING!!!
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: Amazing series, I really loved it. If you enjoyed the series you will totally want this set. I guarantee it!
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: I didn't realize it until I actually got the DVD that Season Four has some of my all-time favorite W&G episodes!  I absolutely love "Crouching Father, Hidden Husband" - it's so nice to see Karen & Will in scenes together picking on each other for a change.  "Prison Blues" is also great and features one of my favorite W&G guest stars - Zandra Eileen Brennan.  "Loose Lips..." is when Jack's boss Parker Posey has a crush on Will - great stuff there too.  "Moveable Feast" and "Bed Bath and Beyond" are definitely masterpieces of writing and acting.  One of my all-time favorites is "Stakin' Care of Business" - Jack and Will are so hilarious in this episode; and Karen & Grace are just as hilarious locking each other in the elevator.  The Matt Damon episode is one of the best 'guest star' episodes out there.  There are a few episodes in here that I can take or leave, but for the most part, W&G was still going strong in Season 4.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: It's been a while since "Will & Grace:Season Three" came out. But now, thank God this is finally coming out. I have highly anticipated it. This is one of my favorite seasons. I'm so glad!!!

I cut off my cable for it was nothing but hatefulness from the right wing and even the advertisements have a lean to the right.  so if you are among of the haters of American humor or life, then don't buy them. but if you are a liberal thinker these are so funny and when I am feeling sad down and out, I turn on my Blu Fly I put in this DVR or one of my others... Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: This season marked the end of my interest in "Will & Grace." During these episodes, the show really veers away from the original premise, a straight woman living with a homosexual man.The season begins with the continuation of the romance between Grace (Debra Messing) and Nathan (Woody Harrelson). This storyline really started me to dislike the show for two reasons: 1) Any boyfriend broke up the great comedic chemistry between Will (Eric McCormack) and Grace; 2) Woody Harrelson's character was altered from the one he portrayed at the end of Season 3 to make him a more believable romantic interest for Grace.This season also marks the complete transformation of Jack and Karen from hilariously quirky to unlikeably mean.The real lowlight of this series is the Glenn Close episode, in which she plays a coked-up photographer. This episode ranks as the worst and most embarassing guest shot in TV history and leads into the incredibly dumb storyline about Will and Grace trying to have a baby that finally caused me to stop watching this show.However, the episode with Ms. Close's "Fatal Attraction" co-star, Michael Douglas, is absolutely hilarious. Matt Damon is also very funny as a heterosexual acting gay to be in Jack's choir.But aside from these episodes, by Season 4, "Will & Grace" was really more of the same jokes that everyone now knew were coming and storylines that distorted the characters we came to like in Seasons 1 to 3.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST SEASONS OF WILL AND GRACE. YOU EITHER LOVE IT OR YOU HATE IT. THIS SEASON HAS SOME OF THE BEST GUEST STARS ON THE PLANET! IF YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN WILL AND GRACE WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN? IF YOU WANT TO SEE WHAT IT'S ALL ABOUT JUST WATCH IT ON TV; ITAIRS EVERY NIGHT ON WE AND LOGO. GIVE IT A TRY WHAT HAVE YOU GOT TO LOOSE?

reviewText: I plan on giving this to my wife for christmas.  We've seen almost all Will & Grace shows and almost every show we've seen never got boring.  Comparing this to the seasons of 'Friends', I'm guessing that the writers knew when to stop writing for the show, because with 'Friends' going out to 10 seasons, there were some shows that actually were really boring....  I really like Will & Grace and recommend it to anyone who wants to watch a good comedy show.

reviewText: I have been checking here a lot the last several months and have been wondering why it takes so long for these seasons to be released on DVD when all these other shows come right out on DVD even when they air them on TV the same year. Will & Grace is a really good show and worth watching.  They should start releasing the other seasons a little more quicker. I also agree with these other guys, they should release a BETTER & WORTHY DVD at least a better one than Season 3 which to me was a poor set with no subtitles or any extras. Lets HOPE THIS IS A WORTHY DVD COLLECTION FOLKS!!!!!!!!!
summary: About TIME and better be a worthy DVD collection

reviewText: I don't know what went wrong, but this show isn't funny by this season. Now, you end up watching it for the story and not realising that there are no laughs. Every now and again when the characters 'push political/sexual barriers' the audience shreaks and howls - is that what this top-notch show has come to?

Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: This is one of television's rare treats, a show I still make time to see. Perhaps the funniest sitcom ( God, how I hate that term - situation comedy ) on network TV. Hysterical. Laugh out loud funny. And it is so much more than the one trick "gay man and straight best girl friend" that many people think it is. The antics of sidekicks Jack and Karen alone make it indespensable viewing. If and when Will and Grace gets the axe, the Jack and Karen Show would be a sure fire hit.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: Will & Grace is amazing. The writers are so talented and the cast is so funny. I love this show because the ideas are so fresh and the actors are so perfect together. I think that Megan Mullaly (i don't know how to spell her last name) is so great and her lines are so well delivered. I think that Sean Hayes is the funniest one on the show because he his character is the dumbiest one and he is so gullible like in one episode he thought Santa decorated the window at Barney's. And in another he thought Cher was god (well she might be to some people, but I dont think anybody ever prays to her) Anyway this is a great show and a must buy dvd.
summary: Will & Grace has another great season
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: Season 4, like all of this show's seasons, is very funny.  The show has never needed its guest stars to be entertaining, and has been the only sitcom to ever successfully you guests stars (repeatedly) without diminshing the roles of the stars in the episodes and seemlessly putting them into an episode.This is a show I did not watch on live TV, got hung up on it during reruns so picked up the DVDs.  It is a great show, but sadly this season ends on a sour note.  Forgetting it's a comedy, we watch Karen and Jack have dreams crushed, and Will and Grace think about having a baby together and disappointing each other - -  only to roll into next season with Will angry at Grace when she finally meets Mr. Right.Ultimately, the Season is worth the sad end; I only hope Season 5 has a quick redemption.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: I only discovered Will & Grace in reruns.  It's one of the funniest shows on air right now.  For those of you who think that the premise is unbelievable, it's not.  I've had a best friend who was gay and a lot of the dynamics from the show are true to life.  I know having gone through some if it.Will and Grace are best friends but Will is a gay man and Grace is a heterosexual female.  They remain friends no matter what happens even though they do fight and walk away from each other for awhile.  They always get back together.  Jack and Karen are the friends that makeup the foursome.  In Jack's case though he's more leach than friend.  He never keeps a job for long, always wants a handout and fancies himself a great want to be actor, dancer and singer.  Jack is gay and flamboyant which drives Will nuts because while he is gay he is not outrageously so nor is he effeminant.  Karen is filthy rich.  She's a pill popping, boozing, abuse giving, well dressed woman who thinks that other folks were created to serve her every desire.Kudos to the casting deparment.  Each member of the foursome creates their character accurately.  Normally in tv land, it might take two or three seasons before the players really nail their characters down but the cast of Will and Grace did it in half a season.  By the middle of season one, the Karen character had found her niche with the high pitched nasal voice and her sarcastic laugh.  All play off of each other very well.  In fact I find Megan's (Karen) real voice much more annoying than her false one.  All in all I have to say that I am putting this show in my personal list of all time funny shows (All in the Family, Mash, Night Court, Frazier, Absolutely Fabulous) with AITF in the lead of course.I do wish the studio would get it together and release season five already.  What's up with that?  Fans are tired of waiting.  Come on people get the lead out and crank it up!!
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: I am a definitely-NOT-GAY heterosexual male, so naturally growing up the schoolyard talk always looked down upon gayishness and such, and when I matured I just accepted these hurtful assumptions as the truth.  However, I finally just couldn't take it anymore and one day tuned into Will & Grace, and it made me see things with a fresh perspective.  I believe I am now more tolerant of gayability, and see people gay people as real people who are just "gaytastic"!  That being said, I am still NOY GAY.  At least I'm pretty sure.  This show made me doubt myself sometimes.  So I think I'm not gay.  Well . . . am I gay?  I just don't know anymore!!!  This is such a great show and the gay guys in it are so hot!!  BUT I'M NOT GAY!!! . . . . OR AM I?!?!?!?  AAAHHHH!!!
summary: Made me re-examine my assumptions about gayity
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: Season 4 opens with Grace and Nathan still together but soon on the rebound. Some of the famous guest appearances this season include Cher, Rosie O'Donnell, Parkey Posey, Eileen Brennan, Leslie Ann Warren, Sydney Pollack, Blythe Danner and Michael Douglas.Episodes include:#1 - The Third Wheel Gets The Grace - Nathan (Woody Harrelson) feels like the third wheel when Will returns from his vacation and resumes his friendship with Grace. Jack takes Elliot shopping for school clothes.#2 - Past and Presents - Will's former bully from school is hired as a new attorney at his firm. Grace is upset that Karen's birthday gift to Nathan is better than hers.#3 - Crouching Father, Hidden Husband - Jacks talks Grace into being Elliot's date at his school prom. Karen pulls one too many practical jokes on Will.#4 - When Will flubs his lines during an interview with a tv reporter, Jack talks him into attending his acting class. Grace moves in with Karen and quickly becomes accustomed to Karen's extravagant lifestyle. Eileen Brennan guest stars as Zandra.#5 - Loose Lips Sinks Relationships - Jack's boss has a crush on Will but Will thinks that she he interested in him for a modeling job. Karen and Nathan compare sex stories. Parkey Posey guest stars as Dorleen.#6 - Grace is upset over Nathan's marriage proposal due to the fact that he popped the question while they were having sex.#7 - Grace retreats to her bed after her break-up with Nathan. Will tries to cheer her up.#8 - Star-Spangled Banter - Will and Grace become embroiled in politics when they each support a different city council candidate.#9 - Moveable Feast - So that they can be together on Thanksgiving, Will, Grace, Karen and Jack travel together to meet their respective families. Guest stars Debbie Reynolds, Beau Bridges, Lainie Kazan, Blythe Danner, Nick Offerman (Megan Mullally's real-life husband).#10 - Stakin' Care of Business - Grace asks Karen for a loan to expand her company. Will and Jack join a gym.#11 - Jingle Balls - Will is embarrassed by his ballet dancer boyfriend. Jack gets to decorate the window at Barney's. Guest star Parkey Posey.#12 - Whoa, Nelly - Jack and Karen get into the horse business. Will and Grace attempt to get Will's father's girlfriend interested in someone else, but their plans backfire when they enlist their gay friend Larry to play the bait. Leslie Ann Warren guest-stars.#13 - Grace in the Hole - While visiting Stan in prison, Grace meets a former high school friend, who is also serving time.#14 - Dyeing is Easy, Comedy is Hard - Grace takes Will along to her ex-fiancee's wedding so that she doesn't look destitute. Jack has a run-in with Elliot's mother. Guest star - Rosie O'Donnell.#15 - Jack tries to prove that his rival at the Gay Man's Chorus is straight. Karen asks Will to pose as her lover at a Valentine's Day party. Guest stars - Matt Damon, Leslie Jordan.#16 - Someone Old, Someplace New - Will and Grace search for a larger apartment. Jack films a documentary of Karen's life and meets her estranged mother. Suzanne Pleshette and Sandra Bernhard guest star.#17 - Something Borrowed, Something's Due - (Part 2) Will and Grace miss their old apartment. Jack tries to reconcile Karen and her mother. Suzanne Pleshette guest stars.#18 - Cheatin Trouble Blues - Will gives his reconciled parents a romantic cruise.#19 - Went to a Garden Potty - Will proudly displays a beloved garden gnome in their community garden. Jack is worried that his role as a heterosexual in a mattress commericial will stereotype him. Eileen Brennan guest stars.#20 - He Shoots, They Snore - Jack asks Will to accompany Elliot to a basketball tournament. Grace teaches a design class but her students seem to be more interested in celebrity gossip.#21 - Wedding Bells - Grace gets too caught up in wedding fantasies when Will asks her to assist a friend with wedding plans. Jack becomes jealous when Will and Karen get chummy over a book that they are reading.#22 - Fagel Attraction - Will's laptop gets stolen and he meets a closet detective who takes an interest in him. Grace's neighbor Val opens a rival business. Molly Shannon and Michael Douglas guest star.#23 - Hocus Focus - Will wins a phography session with a famous celebrity photographer. Will recruits Karen for his magic act. Glenn Close guest stars.#24 - A Buncha White Chicks Sittin' Around Talkin' - Will asks Grace to be the mother of his baby. Jack auditions for a Broadway production.#25 - A.I. Artificial Insemination - Will and Grace decide to have a baby but encounter obstacles at the insemination lab. Jack wants to give up show business until he gets a dream message from his idol Cher. Cher and Rip Torn guest star.
Title: Will & Grace - Season Four

reviewText: I think I got my Will and Grace season four in July 2005. I have all four seasons and they are all great. Can anyone PLEASE help hurry up Season five. It's driving me crazy waiting for it. I love all the Will and Grace episode.

reviewText: I used to think that MASH had the longest span of seasons that weren't funny.  But at least it had some good seasons before it jumped the shark and Alan Alda turned into the War Is Hell Show over and over again.I've seen WILL & GRACE shows from the beginning up to now, and they are not funny.  You can't even fly cross country without having to sit through at least one episode anymore.  And they're still not funny.WILL & GRACE is the only show I know that jumped the shark the second it started.
summary: How Does This Show Keep Going?
